result.execSummary:
The defendant Preston S Sprader was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total bond of $400 applied to court costs. Balance due within 60 days. Failure to pay may result in a jail term of 1 day for every $25 owed consecutive to condition time. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-No contact with Leah Braun.
-Pay supervision fees.

Judge Williams appears in absence of Judge Malloy /Defendant Preston S Sprader in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State recommendation on 15CF59 of probation 3 years, no contact with L.B., no controlled substance, 6 months condition time and on 14CM788 1 yr probation with same conditions. Court renders sentence. Court denies expungement request of defendant. Bond money on 14CM788 and 15CM59 to be applied to court costs on 15CF59.
Sentencing hearing at 06-18-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant Preston S Sprader in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea to the information. Court examines defendant and finds him guilty. On request of defense counsel, sentencing adjourned. At the time of sentencing, State will recommend 3 years probation with 6 months jail as a condition, no contact with victim, absolute sobriety, no controlled substances.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-04-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant Preston S Sprader in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Buckett requests a scheduled disposition date. Bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on April 8, 2015 at 08:45 am.
On request of Atty. Buckett case rescheduled from 4/6/2015 to 4/8/2015 at 8:45 am. Notice to parties.

Defendant Preston S Sprader in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea.

Defendant Preston S Sprader in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel states first appearance on this case, requesting prelim hrg; waiving timelimits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

State by DA Gerol.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with Atty Alme Boaz.  Counsel waives reading and advises the defendant qualifies for public defender representation.  Court finds probable cause.  State recommends $250 cash bail w/conditions.  Counsel requesting status of prelim hrg; waiving timelimits.  Court orders $250 cash bail w/conditions:  no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.  Court orders matter adj to 2/19 at 10 am for status of prelim hrg.
